info.title: Karrio API
info.description:
## API Reference

Karrio is an open source multi-carrier shipping API that simplifies the integration of logistic carrier services.

The Karrio API is organized around REST. Our API has predictable resource-oriented URLs, accepts JSON-encoded
request bodies, returns JSON-encoded responses, and uses standard HTTP response codes, authentication, and verbs.

The Karrio API differs for every account as we release new versions.
These docs are customized to your version of the API.


## Versioning

When backwards-incompatible changes are made to the API, a new, dated version is released.
The current version is `2022.6.1`.

Read our API changelog and to learn more about backwards compatibility.

As a precaution, use API versioning to check a new API version before committing to an upgrade.


## Environments

The Karrio API offer the possibility to create and retrieve certain objects in `test_mode`.
In development, it is therefore possible to add carrier connections, get live rates,
buy labels, create trackers and schedule pickups in `test_mode`.


## Pagination

All top-level API resources have support for bulk fetches via "list" API methods. For instance, you can list addresses,
list shipments, and list trackers. These list API methods share a common structure, taking at least these
two parameters: limit, and offset.

Karrio utilizes offset-based pagination via the offset and limit parameters.
Both parameters take a number as value (see below) and return objects in reverse chronological order.
The offset parameter returns objects listed after an index.
The limit parameter take a limit on the number of objects to be returned from 1 to 100.


```json
{
    "count": 100,
    "next": "/v1/shipments?limit=25&offset=50",
    "previous": "/v1/shipments?limit=25&offset=25",
    "results": [
        { ... },
    ]
}
```

## Metadata

Updateable Karrio objects—including Shipment and Order—have a metadata parameter.
You can use this parameter to attach key-value data to these Karrio objects.

Metadata is useful for storing additional, structured information on an object.
As an example, you could store your user's full name and corresponding unique identifier
from your system on a Karrio Order object.

Do not store any sensitive information as metadata.

## Authentication

API keys are used to authenticate requests. You can view and manage your API keys in the Dashboard.

Your API keys carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secure! Do not share your secret
API keys in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, and so forth.

Authentication to the API is performed via HTTP Basic Auth. Provide your API token as
the basic auth username value. You do not need to provide a password.

```shell
$ curl https://instance.api.com/v1/shipments \
    -u key_xxxxxx:
# The colon prevents curl from asking for a password.
```

If you need to authenticate via bearer auth (e.g., for a cross-origin request),
use `-H "Authorization: Token key_xxxxxx"` instead of `-u key_xxxxxx`.

All API requests must be made over [HTTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Secure).
API requests without authentication will also fail.

post.description: Authenticate the user and return a token pair
Authenticate the user and return a token pair
Get a verified JWT token pair by submitting a Two-Factor authentication code.
Verify an existent authentication token

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

post.description: Create a new address.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url /v1/addresses \
  --header 'Authorization: Token <API_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
    "address_line1": "125 Church St",
    "person_name": "John Doe",
    "company_name": "A corp.",
    "phone_number": "+1 514 000 0000",
    "city": "Moncton",
    "country_code": "CA",
    "postal_code": "E1C4Z8",
    "residential": false,
    "state_code": "NB"
}'

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

get.description: Returns the list of configured carriers

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: This flag indicates whether to return active carriers only

parameters.name: system_only
parameters.description: This flag indicates that only system carriers should be returned

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

post.description: Create a new customs declaration.

Import csv, xls and xlsx data files for:
- tracking data
- orders data
- shipments data
- billing data (soon)

**This operation will return a batch operation that you can poll to follow
the import progression.**

resource_type.description: The type of the resource to import

data_template.description:
A data template slug to use for the import.

**When nothing is specified, the system default headers are expected.**

resource_type.description: The type of the resource to import

data_template.description:
A data template slug to use for the import.

**When nothing is specified, the system default headers are expected.**

get.description: Retrieve all shipping document upload records.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

post.description: Upload a shipping document.

get.description: Retrieve a shipping document upload record.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

post.description: Create a new order object.

put.description:
This operation allows for updating properties of an order including `options` and `metadata`.
It is not for editing the line items of an order.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

post.description: Create a new parcel.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

post.description: Schedule a pickup for one or many shipments with labels already purchased.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url /v1/pickups/<PICKUP_ID> \
  --header 'Authorization: Token <API_KEY>' \
  --data '{
    "pickup_date": "2020-10-25",
    "address": {
      "address_line1": "125 Church St",
      "person_name": "John Doe",
      "city": "Moncton",
      "country_code": "CA",
      "postal_code": "E1C4Z8",
      "state_code": "NB",
    },
    "ready_time": "13:00",
    "closing_time": "17:00",
    "instruction": "Should not be folded",
    "package_location": "At the main entrance hall",
    "tracking_numbers": [
        "8545763607864201002"
    ]
}'

post.description: Modify a pickup for one or many shipments with labels already purchased.
Cancel a pickup of one or more shipments.
Schedule one or many parcels pickup
Cancel a pickup previously scheduled
Modify a scheduled pickup

The Shipping process begins by fetching rates for your shipment.
Use this service to fetch a shipping rates available.

Once the shipping rates are retrieved, provide the required info to
submit the shipment by specifying your preferred rate.
Cancel a shipment and the label previously created

get.description: You can track a shipment by specifying the carrier and the shipment tracking number.

parameters.name: hub
parameters.description: A carrier_name of a hub connector

parameters.name: carrier_name
parameters.description:
carrier_name used to fulfill the shipment
Values: `amazon_mws`, `aramex`, `australiapost`, `canadapost`, `canpar`, `chronopost`, `dhl_express`, `dhl_poland`, `dhl_universal`, `dicom`, `dpdhl`, `easypost`, `eshipper`, `fedex`, `freightcom`, `generic`, `purolator`, `royalmail`, `sendle`, `sf_express`, `tnt`, `ups`, `ups_freight`, `usps`, `usps_international`, `yanwen`, `yunexpress`

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

post.description: Create a new shipment instance.

put.description:
This operation allows for updating properties of a shipment including `label_type`, `reference`, `payment`, `options` and `metadata`.
It is not for editing the parcels of a shipment.

delete.description: Void a shipment with the associated label.

post.description: Select your preferred rates to buy a shipment label.
Refresh the list of the shipment rates

details and events of a shipping in progress.

The OTP (One Time Password) token received by the user from the
configured Two Factor Authentication method.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description:
<details>
<summary>Commodity user references metadata.</summary>

```
{
    "part_number": "5218487281",
    "reference1": "# ref 1",
    "reference2": "# ref 2",
    "reference3": "# ref 3",
    "reference4": "# ref 4",
    ...
}
```
</details>

Duty.description:
The payment details.
Note that this is required for a Dutiable parcel shipped internationally.

packaging_type.title: Packaging type
packaging_type.description:
The parcel's packaging type. **Note that the packaging is optional when using a package preset** values:
`envelope` `pak` `tube` `pallet` `small_box` `medium_box` `your_packaging` For carrier specific packaging types, please consult the reference.

package_preset.title: Package preset
package_preset.description:
The parcel's package preset.

For carrier specific package presets, please consult the reference.

is_document.title: Is document
is_document.description: Indicates if the parcel is composed of documents only

reference_number.title: Reference number
reference_number.description: The parcel reference number. (can be used as tracking number for custom carriers)

freight_class.title: Freight class
freight_class.description: The parcel's freight class for pallet and freight shipments.

options.title: Options
options.description:
<details>
<summary>Parcel specific options.</summary>

```
{
    "insurance": "100.00",
    "insured_by": "carrier",
}
```

Please check the docs for more details.
</details>

Charge.description: list of the rate's additional charges

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The rate monetary values currency code

total_charge.title: Total charge
total_charge.description:
The rate's monetary amount of the total charge.
This is the gross amount of the rate after adding the additional charges

extra_charges.description: list of the rate's additional charges

test_mode.title: Test mode
test_mode.description: Specified whether it was created with a carrier in test mode

Rate.description: The list for shipment rates fetched previously

services.description:
The carriers services requested for the shipment. Please consult the reference for specific carriers services.
Note that this is a list because on a Multi-carrier rate request you could specify a service per carrier.

options.title: Options
options.description:
<details>
<summary>The options available for the shipment.</summary>

```
{
    "currency": "USD",
    "insurance": 100.00,
    "cash_on_delivery": 30.00,
    "shipment_date": "2020-01-01",
    "dangerous_good": true,
    "declared_value": 150.00,
    "email_notification": true,
    "email_notification_to": "shipper@mail.com",
    "signature_confirmation": true,
}
```

Please check the docs for carrier specific options.
</details>

rates.description: The list for shipment rates fetched previously

carrier_ids.description:
The list of configured carriers you wish to get rates from.

*Note that the request will be sent to all carriers in nothing is specified*

created_at.title: Created at
created_at.description:
The shipment creation datetime

Date Format: `YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.mmmmmmz`

messages.description: The list of note or warning messages

test_mode.title: Test mode
test_mode.description: Specified whether it was created with a carrier in test mode

Shipment.description: The shipments associated with the order.

options.title: Options
options.description:
<details>
<summary>The options available for the order shipments.</summary>

```
{
    "currency": "USD",
    "paid_by": "third_party",
    "payment_account_number": "123456789",
    "duty_paid_by": "third_party",
    "duty_account_number": "123456789",
    "invoice_number": "123456789",
    "invoice_date": "2020-01-01",
    "single_item_per_parcel": true,
    "carrier_ids": ["canadapost-test"],
}
```

Please check the docs for shipment specific options.
</details>

shipments.description: The shipments associated with the order.

test_mode.title: Test mode
test_mode.description: Specify whether the order is in test mode or not.

options.description:
<details>
<summary>The options available for the shipment.</summary>

```
{
    "currency": "USD",
    "insurance": 100.00,
    "cash_on_delivery": 30.00,
    "shipment_date": "2020-01-01",
    "dangerous_good": true,
    "declared_value": 150.00,
    "email_notification": true,
    "email_notification_to": "shipper@mail.com",
    "signature_confirmation": true,
}
```

Please check the docs for carrier specific options.
</details>

service.title: Service
service.description: **Specify a service to Buy a label in one call without rating.**

services.description:
The requested carrier service for the shipment. Please consult the reference for specific carriers services.
Note that this is a list because on a Multi-carrier rate request you could specify a service per carrier.

carrier_ids.description:
The list of configured carriers you wish to get rates from.

*Note that the request will be sent to all carriers in nothing is specified*

services.description:
The requested carrier service for the shipment. Please consult [the reference](#operation/references) for specific carriers services.

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL of the webhook endpoint.

description.title: Description
description.description: An optional description of what the webhook is used for.

enabled_events.description: The list of events to enable for this endpoint.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Indicates that the webhook is disabled

last_event_at.title: Last event at
last_event_at.description: The datetime of the last event sent.

test_mode.title: Test mode
test_mode.description: Specified whether it was created with a carrier in test mode

success.title: Success
success.description: Specify whether the operation was successful
